u.s: Do you think it makes sencesense to read Shakespeare although it is over 400 years old?
Yes, I think it is very important!
Why?
This is such an old way of speaking English.
Nobody talks like that nowadays.
Besides, we live in Germany so why do we have to deal with this language anyway?
You see, reading Shakespearean plays and sonnets is not just about undersanding the language.
It is about grasping the real meaning.
In his poems, especially sonnets, he always talks about love, death, greed, hat, jealousy etc., which are timeless themes!
Timeless themes?
What do you mean by that?
Timeless themes are topics that are and always will be relevant to humanity.
Love for example, as I already meantioned.
Love is a topic which for most poeple is the most important thing in life.
So by reading Shakespeare's sonnets you can really understand what love is about and how Shakespeare saw it.
Yes that is true, but he is not the only one who wrote about these topics.
There are plenty of other writers who use normal English and still write beautiful works.
You are right, there are other writers.
But Shakespeare is not like any other writer.
Shakespeare manages to write about the beauty and the ugliness of life at the same time, which is incredible.
When reading his sonnets you really get how complicated life is, how there are things in life which are beautiful, but devistatingdevastating at the same time.
I don't think that any other writer was or will be able to do it the way he did.
I have not thought of it this way.
Also, and now I am talking about his plays, every person, at some point in his life, will be able to relate to certain characters from Shakespeare's plays.
Because these characters experience things like love, murder, hate etc. which eerybody will eventually make the same experiences with.
Yes, you are right.
Another reason why Shakespeare is still relevant today are his quotes.
Shakespeare gets quoted on a regular basis in our everyday life, and not only in English, to answer your question why we need it in Germany.
Quotes like to be or not to be get translated to almost every language in the world, and get used by many people.
Beside from that, almost everybody knows Shakespeare, or at least has heard his name at least once in his life, which proves just how important he is.
These are some good points.
In addition, he invented more than 1700 words we use nowadays.
Many words we use are invented by Shakespeare, without us even knowing.
So all in all, Shakespeare plays a big wole in our loves and will, I think, still be relevant a long time from now.
You totally convinced me, now I understand why we deal with Shakespeare at school.
